alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 12:14PM MDT until July 07 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The McBride burn scar in... South Central Lincoln County in central New Mexico... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 1214 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the northern part of the McBride Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Gavilan Canyon Road, Blue Lake Drive, Eagle Creek Canyon Road and areas downstream to the Rio Ruidoso. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the McBride Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and possible debris flows of ash, soot, burned timber water and soil within and around the McBride Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the McBride wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
